page.title: 01WOODSTOCK AND ITS LOCALITY
page.content: Woodstock itself is a quaint town set in rolling Cotswold countryside. It is noted for many things. It attracts tourists because of Blenheim and its pubs and hotels. Although it is small enough to be a village, it has a Town Hall and is therefore a town. At the Town Hall, jumble sales and fetes are held annually for local charities. East of Woodstock is Shipton-on- Cherwell with its cement quarry and recording studios. Blue Circle owns the quarry on Bunkers Hill and digs all year round for limestone to make cement.The manor house has been bought by Virgin Records and converted into a recording studio. The farming around Woodstock is mostly cereal crops. Nearly all of the land is owned by the Duke of Marlborough and rented by the farmers.
